name: #1 Tournament
description: The first tournament hosted in the Stormbound community, there were no prizes to gain, only honor and fame!

name: Easter Tournament
description: A small tournament made in Easter, with a Steam game as prize.

name: HoS Tournament
description: The new Harvesters of Souls card was added to the game! Built by the community, this tournament was made to show it off, and see its power.

name: Kingdom Wars Tournament
description: The biggest tournament Stormbound has ever seen! The 4 factions battled against each other round robin style! Each player brought glory to their faction, and the MVP got extra prizes.

name: Diamond Tournament
description: Only the top of the top could join! In a battle of wits and high strategy, this tournament was hosted for Diamond players only.

name: Generals Tournament
description: Prepare your battalions! A legendary in each deck, acting as a general to guide your battles! The most powerful general across the whole tournament would bring extra prizes to their players.

name: Current Tournament
description: One of the first tournaments to try out battling at current levels, with each level being divided in groups.

name: Sealed Tournament
description: No deckbuilding required! In this tournament you were given a random deck with which you had to battle your way to the top!

name: Pauper Tournament
description: The real royals of a deck are rares and commons! In this tournament decks were made only of those two types of cards.

name: Small Random Tournament
description: This was a smaller tournament Kepp hosted while he prepared a bigger one, to keep the community entertained using random decks

name: Elders Tournament
description: The elders just arrived to Stormbound! Players battled using these new cards to prove their power!

name: All or Nothing
description: In All or Nothing, if the game reaches 15 mana and no one has won, it will be counted as a draw and nobody takes that round.

name: Ban Tourney 1
description: The Ban Tourney had a very big list of unbalanced and commonly used cards banned, forcing to get creative.

name: Stormblind
description: In Stormbound, players cover their own screens so that they can only see the first two rows of the battlefield — hence the name “Stormblind”.

name: Infinity Tournament
description: The Infinity Tournament was played with the concept that winning any game would result in a gain of points, and the contestants with the least amount of points every round would get eliminated.

name: Designers Tournament
description: The Designers Tournament faced vanilla cards (cards with no ability) against non-vanilla cards to see which were the best.

name: Reckless Draft 1
description: Through the use of a bot, players are presented with 12 separate selections of cards and must choose a card from each set, drafting a 12-card deck to battle against other players.

name: Black Sheep Tournament
description: The Black Sheep Tournament imposed specific “black sheep” cards which had to be played before a win could be claimed.

name: Faction Wars – Season 1
description: Each season, represent your favorite faction and fight against other factions to score as many points as possible.

name: Renaissance Tournament
description: The Renaissance Tournament aimed to bring back veteran players and navigating a set of challenging deck restrictions.

name: Battle Week
description: The Battle Week event was a survival of the most active, seeing players not only win a lot, but also play a match a day.

name: Snowball Tournament
description: The Snowball tournament relies on not playing any card before 6 mana (7 for the second player). The goal of the tournament was to compose heavy decks, which can start strong right from the opening move.

name: Faction Wars – Season 2
description: Each season, represent your favorite faction and fight against other factions to score as many points as possible.

name: Reckless Draft 2
description: Through the use of a bot, players are presented with 12 separate selections of cards and must choose a card from each set, drafting a 12-card deck to battle against other players.

name: Odd & Even Tournament
description: The Odd & Even Tournament relied on having only odd or even cards within a single deck, preventing most of the main combos from being played.
